posts.title: Welcome to Ghost
posts.markdown:
You're in! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. Go ahead and edit this post to get going and learn how it all works!

## Getting Started

Writing in markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use *formatting* shortcuts to style your content. For example, a list:

* Item number one
* Item number two
    * A nested item
* A final item

or with numbers!

1. Remember to buy some milk
2. Drink the milk
3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

### Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in url, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to [the Ghost website](http://ghost.org). Neat.

### What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

![The Ghost Logo](http://tryghost.org/ghost.png)

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

![A bowl of bananas]


### Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. It was probably very wisdomous. Is wisdomous a word? Find out in a future release when we introduce spellcheck! For now - it's definitely a word.

> Wisdomous - it's definitely a word.

### Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline `<code>` blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

    .awesome-thing {
        display: block;
        width: 100%;
    }

### Ready for a Break? 

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

---

### Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can  write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

<input type="text" placeholder="I'm an input field!" />

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)

posts.title: One year in development
posts.markdown: ###Whoa! It's been a while since the [annoucement](http://game-craft.com/blog/2013/02/27/warcluster-announcement/?lang=en) of WarCluster one year ago! The official birthdate is **07.01.2013** because that's the date when warcluster.com as domain has been activated :) It's been a wild year full of adventures and we continue doing WarCluster in our spare time - towards greatness and epicness! That's why we thought about how to celebrate the birthday party - the obvious way was to start a blog :D Here we'll try to share everything that's on our mind we think you may find it interesting/amusing/full of crap/etc. ###Rocking the socks of our Alpha This year we managed to accomplish a couple of things. One of those is going to version 0.0.69 which marks the nearing of the closed beta. We've managed to pull a couple of funny development ideas (more on that soon) which gave us the chance to make this ![version 0.0.69](/content/images/2014/Jan/Screenshot_from_2014_01_15_03_29_59.png) from this ![](http://static.ow.ly/photos/original/2Whvg.png) The changes may seem subtle but they contribute a lot to the gameplay (diplomatically and strategically speaking) :D Of course this is only the beginning! So far we've managed to play a lot of rounds in the game. We didn't count the victories (maybe we should start) for each person separately but some of the Cluster Emperors where [@vitaliy_filipov](http://twitter.com/vitaliy_filipov), [@k_vladimiroff](http://twitter.com/k_vladimiroff), [@viki_varna](http://twitter.com/viki_varna) & [@Mordevil](http://twitter.com/Mordevil) ### The work so far is extremely fun and awarding :D Check out the **backend github repo code frequency statistics** ![backend github repo code frequency statistics](/content/images/2014/Jan/Screenshot_from_2014_01_15_03_57_01.png) also looking at the **frontend repo punch card** I see we have commits even at 5am ![frontend repo punch card](/content/images/2014/Jan/Screenshot_from_2014_01_15_04_05_31.png) but the winner is 6am so far :D Also we've managed to create 232 cards in [trello](https://trello.com/vitaliyfilipov/recommend) in order to push forward and organize our remote activities :) There're great things coming soon #### UI enhancements #### Spy missions #### Academy logs serving as tutorial #### Leaderboards #### Picking your race of choice #### Doing some dev optimizations and of course fixing bugs along the way :D If you want to get ahead of others you may want to subscribe to the Galactic Cluster newsletter:

posts.title: Lessons learned from first alpha test
The winners from the first alpha test
posts.markdown:
### Hello Generals!

Thank you for participating in the **first** closed [alpha test](http://blog.warcluster.com/tag/alpha-test/) :D 

It was amazing seeing you in space and fighting along side or against you xD The playtest generated *~13 bug reports* - some of them critical for the quality of the gameplay. That's why we'll close the doors to the WarCluster galaxy and focus on fixing issues so later we can have more fun without game-changing bugs. 

The last 7 days were full with surprises. First [@K Vladimiroff](https://twitter.com/K_vladimiroff) and [@viki varna](https://twitter.com/viki_varna) had a strong union (the apex of it was ~60 planets but they were easily defeated by the other players). Unfortunately the other **26 players** didn't made any kind of strong alliance. This led to [@Mordevil](https://twitter.com/mordevil) and [@thral25](https://twitter.com/thral25) overrunning the entire galaxy with their green Emperialism.

![The green blitzkrieg](/content/images/2014/May/10338965_10152214012315777_1321408369_n.jpg)

Their **swift and clever blitzkrieg** managed to secure them the first place which made them enemy number one in the entire galaxy. Unfortunately it was too late for any anti-green activities because *everybody was busy fighting everybody* :D 

The rebel movement *(consisting of ~13 players using facebook chat room for communication)* was pretty weak and disorganized. It managed to create one or two situations for detroning the green Empire but the rebels didn't grasp the oppurtunity and were usually crushed within 4 or 5 hours.

[The comeback of thral25](https://twitter.com/WarCluster/status/465216483103350784)

So this war is ending with @thral25 and @Mordevil (they are the only green players on the server) sky-rocketing the green Empire above all others.

![Race leaderboard](/content/images/2014/May/Screenshot-from-2014-05-15-21-11-07.png)

You can see the individual leaderboard. @thral25 and @Mordevil reserved their place in the WarCluster history as 
# the winners from the first alpha test

![Top ten players](/content/images/2014/May/Screenshot-from-2014-05-15-21-10-45.png)

Thank you all! We're listing the contributors in the first alpha test and hope we'll see eachother again in space. 

![top ten to twenty players](/content/images/2014/May/Screenshot-from-2014-05-15-21-10-50.png)
![top twenty to thirty players](/content/images/2014/May/Screenshot-from-2014-05-15-21-10-55.png)

We hope everybody learned something new about diplomacy and tactics so later the battles will be even more thrilling and exciting >:)

***Quick tip**: hitting Spacebar navigates you to your home planet :D*

posts.title: The Intergalactic Hackerspace Tournament
posts.markdown:
### Hello Admirals!

The second [alpha test](http://blog.warcluster.com/tag/alpha-test/) is over :D Congratulations to the winners and everyone participating!

That's why we're closing the doors to the WarCluster galaxy server until further notice (i.e. until we fix our [bugs](http://warcluster.uservoice.com/forums/214551-general) and add several new features :))

Part of the roadmap is as follows:

- **Optimizing the client** so that the framerate wont drop after ~60 interactive objects. The plan is to support like [50,000](http://www.ianww.com/blog/2012/11/04/optimizing-three-dot-js-performance-simulating-tens-of-thousands-of-independent-moving-objects/) :D

- **Adding max population per planet** so that future Emperors wont "snowball" the entire galaxy so easily :) 


In case you missed the alpha test here's the quick recap - we've started the server and invited **all 6 hackerspaces** in Bulgaria to join the fight simultaneously.

![six hackerspace races](/content/images/2014/Jul/all_races_v02.png)


The event was ~~total disaster~~ glorious - we've managed to hit the limit of the [file descriptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_descriptor) per user on the server... a couple of times! :D It took us ~1 hour to debug the problem, while all people waited. Sorry for that!

![six hackerspace races](/content/images/2014/Jul/2014-07-17-20-55-49_smaller.jpg)

So after we've managed to fix this we've played WarCluster for a couple of hours, some of us till 1a.m. I'm excited because this was 

> the first simultaneous event in the bulgarian hackerspace ecosystem !!!

i.e. people from 6 cities in Bulgaria were online at the same time, playing the same game and having fun together over internet :) 

![InitLab members playing WarCluster](/content/images/2014/Jul/2014-07-17-20-55-39_smaller.jpg)
###### This is InitLab - the epicenter of the space carnage.

We talked over Google Hangout, discussed some WarCluster details (like the basic tutorial) and jumped straight in the game.

![Hackafe members playing WarCluster](/content/images/2014/Jul/10547622_680904488624755_4458501793386899441_n.jpg)
###### This is Hackafe - streaming the google hangout with their beamer :)

#### First Race Dominance -> VarnaLab

The space carnage was tremendous! Until 12a.m. [VarnaLab](http://varnalab.org) had the advantage even though they had fewer players compared to InitLab - second in place (11 vs 18)
![Races leaderboard](/content/images/2014/Jul/10478372_10203054377212860_4638840756503769862_o.jpg)

#### The new world order -> Hackafe

The second playday (the biggest point in the graph) was even more dynamic. More people joined the game, summing the player base to almost ~70 space Admirals 

![Google Analytics Sessions](/content/images/2014/Jul/Screenshot-from-2014-07-24-23-57-31.png)

[Hackafe](http://hackafe.org) did a quick onslaught. After that they slowly started to build their [#WarClusterYellow](https://twitter.com/hashtag/WarClusterYellow?f=realtime) empire. Their persistance and group tactics was the key for their success - playing even when all others were working :D

![WarCluster battle squad station](/content/images/2014/Jul/10556331_10204443926727142_5948276883672630913_n.jpg)

At the end of round they've managed to outplay all others and colonized the amazing number of **876 planets**! This elevated the entire race as galaxy dominators. This is the first time we see only one color on the leaderboard top 10 :D

![Hackafe galaxy dominators top 10](/content/images/2014/Jul/Screenshot-from-2014-07-24-20-34-59.png)

Unfortunately for some - WarCluster is a game that can have only one cosmic Emperor at the end of the round. This time it's [@valexiev](https://twitter.com/valexiev)

![@valexiev](/content/images/2014/Jul/galactic_emperor-1.png)

Also our algorithm for positioning players nearby their twitter friends seem to work ... or at least it's creating an interesting form. Maybe someday we will see more different **star constellations** but for now it's just this ;)

![The war clusters](/content/images/2014/Jul/10496163_10202371743604095_4331521357280509258_o.jpg)
###### This is the WarCluster galaxy zoomed out so that we can see only the suns :)
